---
fork: Prague
---

## Notes

BLS12-381 G1 addition precompile performs point addition on the G1 group of the BLS12-381 elliptic curve. The BLS12-381 curve is defined over a 381-bit prime field and is used for cryptographic operations including digital signatures and zero-knowledge proofs.

More information about BLS12-381 can be found in [EIP-2537](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2537).

## Inputs

| Byte range | Name | Description |
|-----------:|-----:|------------:|
| `[0; 63]` (64 bytes) | x1 | X coordinate of first point on BLS12-381 G1 |
| `[64; 127]` (64 bytes) | y1 | Y coordinate of first point on BLS12-381 G1 |
| `[128; 191]` (64 bytes) | x2 | X coordinate of second point on BLS12-381 G1 |
| `[192; 255]` (64 bytes) | y2 | Y coordinate of second point on BLS12-381 G1 |

Input must be exactly **256 bytes**. Points must be valid G1 curve points and in the correct subgroup.

## Output

| Byte range | Name | Description |
|-----------:|-----:|------------:|
| `[0; 63]` (64 bytes) | x | X coordinate of result point on BLS12-381 G1 |
| `[64; 127]` (64 bytes) | y | Y coordinate of result point on BLS12-381 G1 |

Returns the sum of the two input G1 points.

## Example

| Input | Output |
|------:|-------:|
| `` | `0x000000000000000000000000000000000a40300ce2dec9888b60690e9a41d3004fda4886854573974fab73b046d3147ba5b7a5bde85279ffede1b45b3918d82d0000000000000000000000000000000006d3d887e9f53b9ec4eb6cedf5607226754b07c01ace7834f57f3e7315faefb739e59018e22c492006190fba4a870025` |

## Gas
The gas cost is fixed at 375. However, if the input does not allow to compute a valid result, all the gas sent is consumed.
